content: pattern when doing to where you started slipstitch to the ch1 at the beginning of double-crochets into a chain from the previous row crochet the round do not turn into the chain stitches themselves rather than into the open space for turning chains if your first square is filled-in second round begin with ch3 just like in any double_crochet pattern if your the edging is a simple shell consisting of skip 2 single_crochet double_crochet 7 first square is an open space begin with ch5 counts as double_crochet times in next single_crochet skip 2 single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet begin with ch1 ch2 counts as 1 single_crochet then start the shells along the bottom each shell should cover 2 mesh squares so that both the middles of the shells and the scs in between line up with dcs from the body of the garment bottom corner double_crochet 11 times into the corner single_crochet if this does not quite lie flat for you try 10 or 12 dcs front opening just like along the bottom until you get to the neckline shaping at the marker © proper trappings 2007 page 2 of 3 seilfrettub neerg cid 122 cid 122 cid 122 cid 122 cid 122 cid 122 cid 122 cid 122 83 73 cid 122
